clues.text: Yale University Library classifies books in excess of 27 cm in height or 19 cm in width as this big "O"

Webster says this word may be an "alteration of huge + monstrous"
From the Greek, it's a much larger than life-size statue, such as an ancient wonder
This synonym for "gigantic" was in use more than 200 years before a 1912 event put a new spin on it
The year he turned 32, William Blake published "Songs of" this; by 37 he "lost" his & made "Songs of Experience"
While writing "Tropic of Cancer" in Paris, he served as a proofreader for the French edition of the Chicago Tribune
Of the reaction to this novel, Upton Sinclair said, "I aimed at the public's heart, and by accident I hit it in the stomach"
O, by the way, Willa Cather took the title of this 1913 novel from a Walt Whitman poem
Perhaps it was "An American Tragedy" that there was a ban on this author's semi-autobiographical "The 'Genius'"

The last czar of Russia abdicated in this year

rounds.category: IS THERE A DOCTOR IN THE HOUSE?

clues.text: What's that?  An otologist specializes in the treatment of these organs?
Step on up with this doctor who specializes in the treatment of foot problems

It's the 15-letter word for the type of doctor who deals with the structure, functions & diseases of the eye
Lungs & respiration are the breath of life for this doctor
"What say you to... beef and mustard?" Grumio asks her before a fight in "The Taming of the Shrew"; she approves
In this religion's Upanishads, the soul is described as smaller than a mustard seed yet greater than the sky
To represent his army, Darius sent sesame seeds to this Macedonian, who sent back more potent mustard seeds
American mustard's bright yellow coloring comes from this Asian plant
When the papacy was centered in this city, John XXII appointed an official mustard maker
Civil unrest accompanied the 1974 independence of this country, later invaded to put down a 1983 coup
Dictator Trujillo angered many in the Dominican Republic, like by renaming this capital Ciudad Trujillo
In 1987 allies of this future pres. occupied Port-au-Prince's cathedral when his religious order tried to transfer him
In 1636 the natives probably got restless when Aruba was occupied by this Dutch company (remember your hemisphere)
clues.response: the West India Company (the Dutch West Indies Company accepted)

clues.text: The Chief Minister resigned after criticism of the 1997 volcano crisis in this isle named for a Spanish mountain abbey

rounds.text: He once said, "In all of us there is a hunger, marrow-deep, to know our heritage...who we are and where we have come from"
